item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee
Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security Subcommittee

item.title: To direct the United States Postal Service to designate a single, unique ZIP Code for Windsor Heights, Iowa.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, Post Office, and the District of Columbia.

item.name: Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security Subcommittee

item.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security.

item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S740)

summary.text: Directs the U.S. Postal Service to designate a single ZIP Code applicable to the area encompassing only the city of Windsor Heights, Iowa.

bill.title: A bill to provide for the designation of a single ZIP code for Windsor Heights, Iowa.

item.title: A bill to provide for the designation of a single ZIP code for Windsor Heights, Iowa.
A bill to provide for the designation of a single ZIP code for Windsor Heights, Iowa.

latestAction.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
